intro: Pocockia arabica, commonly known as the Arabian rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Arabian Peninsula. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand extreme drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, helping to conserve water. Pocockia arabica plays a minor role in local ecosystems but is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to desert environments.
